titleStmt.title: To the right Worshipfull, Edward Cooke Esquier, her Maiesties Attorney generall.
titleStmt.author: Anonymus,

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: To the right Worshipfull, Edward Cooke Esquier, her Maiesties Attorney generall.
analytic.author: Anonymus,

monogr.title: Remedies against discontentme [n] t : drawen into seuerall discourses, from the writinges of auncient philosophers. By Anonymus
monogr.author: Anonymus

div.head: To the right Worshipfull, Edward Cooke Esquier, her Maiesties Attorney generall.
div.p:
SJR, hauing receiued many kind fauours from you, & there resting in mee small abilitie, though much will, to deserue them. I thought yet at the least to do, as honest (though vnhahle debtors) are wont, who wanting meanes to make full satisfaction, do straine thē selues to pay interest vntill
some better fortune do befall them. And if you be pleased so to accept of these my labours, I doe promise & protest, that I will seeke by all meanes possible to discharge the whole, as my abilitie shall encrease. Till when & euer, I will wish you as happy, as J deeme you worthy, & remaine

closer.signed: Yours deuoted in most dutifull affection. Anonymus.
